derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a mathematical term): from Latin unus, probably suggested by digit

encyclopedia.content: 韩国Aurora Games公司旗下的首款真实FPS网络游戏《UNIT》，将从2月4日开始进行首次内测。 在去年的韩国游戏展G★中首次公开的《UNIT》，具有可以像MMORPG那样养成角色、给角色赋予个性、使用多种战术等优点。因此，即使把角色养成狙击手，也会根据玩家分配的能力值的不同，出现多种类型的狙击手。 《UNIT》具备的另外一个特点就是可根据人工智能战斗的佣兵系统。若房主选择支持佣兵的地图，就可雇用佣兵当作敌人和我军。佣兵可以

entry.def: If you consider something as a unit, you consider it as a single, complete thing.

example.ex: Agriculture was based in the past on the family as a unit.
example.tran: 过去的农业是以家庭为单位的。

entry.def: A unit is a group of people who work together at a specific job, often in a particular place.

example.tran: 医疗卫生服务研究部门

example.ex: The results from this unit are staggering.
example.tran: 这个团队得出的结果令人吃惊。

entry.tran: （武装部队或警察机关的）小队，分队
entry.def: A unit is a group within an armed force or police force, whose members fight or work together or carry out a particular task.

example.ex: One secret military unit tried to contaminate the drinking water of the refugees...
example.tran: 一个秘密军事分队企图污染难民的饮用水。

example.ex: Two small Marine units have been trapped inside the city for the last 36 hours.
example.tran: 两支海军小分队在过去的36个小时被困在城内。

entry.tran: （常为更大机器一部分的）装置，设备，部件
entry.def: A unit is a small machine which has a particular function, often part of a larger machine.

example.ex: The unit plugs into any TV set.
example.tran: 这个部件能插进任何电视机。

entry.def: A unit of measurement is a fixed standard quantity, length, or weight that is used for measuring things. The litre, the centimetre, and the ounce are all units.
A unit is one of the parts that a textbook is divided into.

means.word_mean: 1. any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange;

sentences.sentence: "the dollar is the United States unit of currency"
"a unit of wheat is a bushel"

means.word_mean: 2. an individual or group or structure or other entity regarded as a structural or functional constituent of a whole;

sentences.sentence: "the reduced the number of units and installations"
"the word is a basic linguistic unit"

means.word_mean: 3. an organization regarded as part of a larger social group;

sentences.sentence: "the coach said the offensive unit did a good job"
"after the battle the soldier had trouble rejoining his unit"

means.word_mean: 4. a single undivided whole;

sentences.sentence: "an idea is not a unit that can be moved from one brain to another"

means.word_mean: 5. a single undivided natural thing occurring in the composition of something else;
6. an assemblage of parts that is regarded as a single entity;

sentences.sentence: "how big is that part compared to the whole?"

auth_sentence.res_content: Who needs a fixed length for this variable unit?

auth_sentence.res_content: I was in the spinal unit for six months.

stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一,单个+ped脚→adj.单足的,独腿的
unique独一无二+ly表副词→adv.独特地,唯一地,珍奇地
uni单一,单个+son声音→一个声音→和谐
unify[v.使联合,统一;使相同,使一致]+ication表名词→unification统一,单一化
uni单一,单个+on表名词→n.联合, 合并
uni单一,单个+t→n.个体,[计量]单位
uni单一,单个+ty表名词→n.团结;统一,一致,整体
unit个体+e→v.联合,团结;统一,合并 v.使联合

Sentence.sentence: The rest of the energy savings comes from the solar units.

And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
If he has ambitious goals and is willing to put in long hours, everyone in his unit will follow his example.
By marking down the unit price.
